result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:30 AM Defendant DANIEL L NIELSEN not in court.  Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for DANIEL L NIELSEN.  Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Review hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty Scott Schlough appointed
Bond mailed for signature

BOND COVERS 22CF137 (MODIFIED) & 22CF139 (MODIFIED).
Defendant shall not possess any weapons.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with Victim 1 or their residence.

Attorney Wade Newell in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless appeared by video for DANIEL L NIELSEN. Defendant DANIEL L NIELSEN appeared by video from Hospital. Court calls case and notes appearances. 22CF137 and 22CF139

Attorney Harless responds
Defendant requests different attorney moving forward
Warrant quashed
